properties.name: Auschwitz Concentration Camp
properties.description: Posted by Dani74Krakow, PolandAuschwitz-Birkenau was the largest of Nazi Germany\'s concentration camps. Located in German-occupied southern Poland, it took its name from the nearby town of Oświęcim. The word Birkenau means \'Birch tree\' of which there are many surronding the Birkenau area of the complex. The complex consisted of three main camps: Auschwitz I, the administrative center; Auschwitz II (Birkenau), an extermination camp or Vernichtungslager; and Auschwitz III (Monowitz), a work camp. There were also around 40 satellite camps. The camp commandant, Rudolf Hoss, testifed at the Nuremberg Trials that up to 2.5 million people had died at Auschwitz. About 90 percent of them Jews from almost every country in Europe. Most of the dead were killed in gas chambers, other deaths were caused by systematic starvation, forced labor, lack of disease control, and individual executions.

properties.name: The Colosseum
properties.description: Posted by Dani74Rome, ItalyThe Roman Colosseum was built in 80 A.D. It was the first permanant amphitheater in Rome. The monumental building was perfect for controlling large crowds. The amphitheater can seat up to 50,000 people. There were about eighty ways to enter the coloseum. This caused easy entrance and exit flow. The amphitheater spanned over more than 6 acres. Shows and circuses were often held in the amphitheater. Chariot races were the most popular event held in the Colosseum. Shows and concerts are still held at the Roman Colosseum today. Although it is now in a ruined condition because of damage caused by earthquakes and stone-robbers, the Colosseum has long been seen as an iconic symbol of Imperial Rome. Today it is one of modern Rome\'s most popular tourist attractions and still has close connections with the Roman Catholic Church.

properties.name: The Eiffel Tower
properties.description: Posted by Dani74Paris, FranceThe Eiffel Tower is located in Paris, France. It was finished with building in May of 1889, and was built to celebrate the great strides that had been made in engineering and science. The Eiffel Tower was always known as the worlds tallest building until around forty years later the Empire State was built. There are exactly 2731 steps to the top of the tower, and it wieghs 7000 tons. The Eiffel Tower was the largest attraction at the Exposition and today it remains the most recognized structure in all of Europe.

properties.name: The Empire State Building
properties.description: Posted by Dani74New York City, New YorkConstruction of the Empire State Building began in March of 1930 on the site of the old Waldorf-Astoria Hotel at 350 Fifth Avenue at 34th Street. It was completed 14 months later in May, 1931. Designed by the architectural firm of Shreve, Lamb, & Harmon Associates, the Empire State Building, at 102 stories, was the tallest building in the world until the completion of the first tower of the World Trade Center in Lower Manhattan in 1972. The cost of the Empire State Building alone was 4,718,000. It was expected to be a cost of 0 million, but did not materialize due to the Great Depression.

properties.name: The Golden Gate Bridge
properties.description: Posted by Dani74San Francisco, CaliforniaThe Golden Gate Bridge was completed after more than 4 years of constuction at a cost of 5 million dollars. It is a popular visitor attraction recognized around the world. The GGB opened to vehicular traffic on May 28, 1937 at twelve o\'clock noon.Its total weight is around 804,700,000 kg. About forty million cars cross the bridge per year. The Golden Gate Bridge\'s 4,200 foot long main suspension span was a world record that stood for 27 years. The bridge\'s two towers rise 746 feet making them 191 feet taller than the Washington Monument. The five lane bridge crosses Golden Gate Strait which is about 400 feet, or 130 meters, deep.

properties.name: The Grand Canyon
properties.description: Posted by Dani74Grand CanyonThe Grand Canyon is a steep-sided gorge carved by the Colorado River in the U.S. state of Arizona.The Grand Canyon is contained within the Grand Canyon National Park which was one of the first national parks in the US. President Theodore Roosevelt loved everything about the Grand Canyon area, and visited on numerous occasions to hunt and enjoy the scenery. The canyon is 277 miles long, ranges in width from 4 to 18 miles and attains a depth of more than a mile.

properties.name: The Great Wall Of China
properties.description: Posted by Dani74ChinaThe Great Wall of China is a series of stone and earthen fortifications in China, built, rebuilt, and maintained between the 5th century BC and the 16th century to protect the northern borders of the Chinese Empire during the rule of successive dynasties. Several walls, referred to as the Great Wall of China, were built since the 5th century BC. It has been estimated that somewhere in the range of 2 to 3 million Chinese died as part of the centuries-long project of building the wall. Many western sections of the wall are constructed from mud, rather than brick and stone, and are more susceptible to erosion.

properties.name: The Metropolitan Cathedral
properties.description: Posted by Dani74Santa Cruz, BoliviaThe original Spanish church was torn down in 1628 while the present Metropolitan Cathedral was under construction. The towering cathedral that stands today, begun in 1567 and finished in 1788, is a blend of baroque, neoclassic, and Mexican churrigueresque architecture. The cathedral is known for its custom wooden vaults with intricate pictorial decorations. It is said to have been built by Mercedario Frey Diego De Porres.

properties.name: The Sahara Desert
properties.description: Posted by Dani74AfricaThe Sahara "The Great Desert", is the world\'s largest hot desert and the world\'s second largest desert after Antarctica. At over 9,000,000 square kilometres, it covers most parts of northern Africa; an area stretching from the Red Sea, including parts of the Mediterranean coasts, to the outskirts of the Atlantic Ocean. The Sahara is even larger than the whole country of Australia. The Sahara has an intermittent history that may go back as much as 3 million years. Some of the sand dunes can get up to 180 meters.

properties.name: The White House
properties.description: Posted by Dani74Washington, D.C.The White House is the official home and workplace of the President of the United States of America. It was built between 1792 and 1800 of white-painted Aquia sandstone in the late Georgian style, it has been the executive residence of every U.S. President since John Adams. When Thomas Jefferson moved into the home in 1801, he, with architect Benjamin Henry Latrobe expanded the building outward, creating two colonnades which were meant to conceal stables and storage. In 1814, during the War of 1812, the mansion was set on fire by British troops, destroying the interior and charring much of the exterior walls. Reconstruction began almost immediately and President James Monroe moved into the partially reconstructed house in October 1817.
